author: emanueltilly
post_text: July 30, 2014 at 1:58 PM#1Hi!I usually have a exec for a certain fixture group with one cue for every col preset I have. At the moment I do I all manual, but is there a way to create a macro that stores preset 1.4.1 thru 1.4.20 for a specific group of lights to cues?Tried some things but they really never worked out that great.

posts.author: emanueltilly
posts.post_text: July 30, 2014 at 1:58 PM#1Hi!I usually have a exec for a certain fixture group with one cue for every col preset I have. At the moment I do I all manual, but is there a way to create a macro that stores preset 1.4.1 thru 1.4.20 for a specific group of lights to cues?Tried some things but they really never worked out that great.

posts.author: TonyVision
posts.post_text: July 31, 2014 at 6:31 AM#2I have something for that.  I'll look around.Its something like...Select Sequence (What seq #?)Group (Which group #?)Preset 1.4.1 Store Cue 1Preset 1.4.2 Store Cue 2etc....You can add a -- Label Cue 1 White -- etc... line in between the store commands the name the cues.

posts.author: wburnss
posts.post_text: August 13, 2014 at 8:37 PM#3Hi,Two macros which I hope will help you.Please respect their ID.900 is made to create a range of executors with single cue (based on given presets).901 is made to create a stack within a list of presets.You have to use release 3.0.0.2 or higher.Filespreset cue executor 900.xml1.69 kB – 74 Downloadspreset cue list 901.xml1.39 kB – 72 Downloads

title: Store range of presets to cuelist?
